intro: Sphaerostephanos uaniensis, commonly known as the Uaniensis Globeflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It is characterized by its unique spherical flower heads, which are composed of numerous small, white to pale yellow petals. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming dense clusters around the base. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat requirements, Sphaerostephanos uaniensis is considered a vulnerable species.
